content.title: The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Disability Allowance Scheme
content.details: The scheme 'The Andaman & Nicobar Islands Disability Allowance Scheme' is implemented by the Directorate of Social Welfare, Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands to provide financial assistance to the differently able unemployed persons with 40% disability or more in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
benefits: The quantum of Disability Allowance shall be ₹2500/- per month subject to eligibility.
The financial assistance sanction shall be payable to a disabled person till his/her death subject to the conditions.
Disability allowance shall become payable from the month following the one in which it is sanctioned.
Payment of allowance shall be made through Bank Account on a monthly basis.
eligibility: Persons who are permanent residents of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or have resided in the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands for more than 10 years at the time of making the application.
A person of age 01 month or more and having 40% & above disability is eligible under the scheme.
There is no income ceiling to avail this allowance.
The applicant is neither in receipt of any other financial assistance/allowances nor employed anywhere.
exclusions: The assistance shall be stopped if the beneficiary gets employment.

The sanctioning authority i.e. Director (Social Welfare) shall have the right to cancel the sanction of assistance at any stage if it is found that it was sanctioned on a mistaken ground or false information tendered or the conditions under which the assistance was granted no longer exist.
documents_required: Proof of Residence i.e. Local Certificate or Islander Identity Card issued by the competent Authority shall be considered.
Certificate to be furnished by State Institute of Education (Mandatory only in case of Persons with disabilities whose age is less than 18 years)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the differently able unemployed persons with 40% disability or more in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

faqs.question: What are the benefits offered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefits include a monthly allowance of ₹2500/- and continued assistance until the death of the disabled person.

faqs.question: How long is the financial assistance provided?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is provided until the death of the disabled person.

faqs.question: What happens if the disabled person passes away before receiving assistance for a specific period?
faqs.answer: If the disabled person dies before receiving assistance for a particular period, the assistance for that period lapses.

faqs.question: When does the Disability Allowance become payable?
faqs.answer: The Disability Allowance becomes payable from the month following the one in which it is sanctioned.

faqs.question: How is the allowance paid?
faqs.answer: The allowance is paid through the beneficiary's Bank Account on a monthly basis.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Permanent residents of the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands or those who have resided in the UT for more than 10 years are eligible.

faqs.question: Under what circumstances can the assistance be canceled?
faqs.answer: The assistance can be canceled if it was sanctioned based on mistaken grounds or false information, or if the conditions for which it was granted no longer exist.

faqs.question: Who has the authority to cancel assistance?
faqs.answer: The Director (Social Welfare) has the authority to cancel the sanction of assistance.

faqs.question: How is the application for allowance verified?
faqs.answer: The application is verified by the Mukhya Sevikas with counter signature or the CDPO concerned before being forwarded to the Director (Social Welfare) for sanction.

faqs.question: What is the procedure for informing about changes in address or employment status?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must inform the Director of Social Welfare within days of any change in address or employment status.

faqs.question: Is there a validity period for the disability certificate?
faqs.answer: Yes, the disability certificate must be renewed every five years.

faqs.question: Can individuals outside the specified disability percentage apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, individuals must have a disability of 40% or more to qualify for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for beneficiaries?
faqs.answer: There is no upper age limit for beneficiaries to avail of the Disability Allowance.
